page.title: 18ATTITUDES - KILMERSDON AREA
page.content: Change in the area has been gentle, but inevitably the older generation who worked all their lives for the Estate feel some loss of security. Rents have risen with the cost of modernising and both old and young worry that the cost of buying or renting their homes is increasingly beyond their means. Few resent newcomers, who have integrated well. The village means just as much to them. They join in whatever is going on and add rather than otherwise to the "family spirit" of the parish. It is a happy and caring community. The mental isolation suffered by so many city dwellers living alone has never been a problem.
